oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chemical methods used at CIMMYT for determining protein quality in cereal grains
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Villegas, E.
Ortega Martinez, E.I.
Bauer, R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Zea mays
Chemical analysis
Cereals
Crops
Protein quality
Triticales
Nitrogen content
Barley
Tryptophan
Lysine
Methods
Varieties
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Chemical methods used at the International Maize and Wheat Improvement Center (CIMMYT) for determining protein quality in cereal grains are briefly described in this bulletin. The techniques included have been used to rapidly identify and select improved cereal lines by screening early generation germplasm from the different breeding programs at CIMMYT. In addition, the use of some of these techniques may provide a more complete biochemical information in outstanding materials which have been selected after several cycles of agronomic improvement. For each method, a small introduction, a list of reagents and equipment needed as well as a
